question: Ghiyaddin Tughlaq Shah II was succeeded by which of the following kings?
explanation: Sultan Abu Bakr Shah who reigned from 1389 CE to 1390 CE, was a Turkic ruler of the Tughlaq dynasty. He was the son of Zafar Khan After Ghiyas-ud-Din Tughluq II was murdered, Abu Bakr became ruler of the Tughlaq empire.
